abstract.p: Josh Max letter on J Hoberman's July 30 article recalls 1970 Mad magazine satire movie Joe (S)

block.p: J. Hoberman's ''Off the Hippies: 'Joe' and the Chaotic Summer of '70'' [July 30] jogged memories of 30 years ago, but not as he probably intended. I was too young to be allowed to see ''Joe'' in 1970, but Mad magazine's satire, ''Shmoe,'' was forever burned into my preteen memory -- enough to make Peter Boyle instantly recognizable even under heavy makeup in ''Young Frankenstein'' four years later. I'm sure I'm not the only one whose first impressions of early 1970's cinema were not ''The Godfather'' and ''The French Connection'' but ''The Oddfather'' and ''What's the Connection?''
